title: Drawing, Design for Benegas Storefront in the Art Deco Style, ca. 1925
title_raw: Design for Benegas Storefront in the Art Deco Style
medium: Brush and brown watercolor, red and cream gouache, black ink, graphite on light-brown paperboard
markings: At lower right, beneath image, small [1/2 x 1 in.] Kilemnik stamp in black:  KILEMNIK & Cia/524 FLORIDA
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite,  lower right:  I
description: Empty storefront vitrine with perpendicular and triangular background shapes visible through the window.  Above window, stone (marble?) sign area showing name, "Benegas," in black on red background surrounded by double frame.  Two pedestrians indicated at right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Benegas Storefront in the Art Deco Style, ca. 1925. Brush and brown watercolor, red and cream gouache, black ink, graphite on light-brown paperboard. 
Gift of Maureen Cogan. 1999-39-25
